intro: Parasenegalia rurrenabaqueana, commonly known as the Rurrenabaque poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests and thrives in shaded environments. Its foliage is often deep green with a waxy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
